newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish bank profits rise to 261 trln lira in '96.
newsitem.headline: Turkish bank profits rise to 261 trln lira in '96.

text.p: Turkish banks' net profits rose to 261 trillion lira last year from 104.7 trillion in 1995, a treasury report said.
Year-on-year consumer price inflation was 79.8 percent last year.

Private banks had the biggest share in the total profit with 196.1 trillion lira, followed by investment and development banks with 26.4 trillion, state banks with 22.6 trillion lira and foreign banks with 16.2 trillion lira, according to the report, prepared by the treasury's bank auditors.
Banks' total assets rose to 8,959 trillion lira in 1996 from 4,136 trillion lira in 1995.
The reports said equities, eroded sharply during a severe financial crisis in 1994, jumped to 799 trillion lira last year from 261 trillion.
